comment.author: 67127882@N07
comment._content: This is during the visit to Tanganyika of the East Africa Royal Commission on Land and Population, which operated between 1953 and 1955. The Chairman of the Commission was Sir Hugh Dow, GCIE. He had served in the Indian Civil Service (ICS) from 1909 until 1947. Sir Frederick Seaford, a member of the Royal Commission, was the chairman of Booker Brothers McConnell & Co. Ltd, a leading company of sugar producers and merchants in Commonwealth countries.  Mr R S Hudson, CMG, had served in Northern Rhodesia from 1919 until about 1950. He was also a member of the Royal Commission.
